basic.floral_language:
Portulaca oleracea 
Floriography: vivid, sunny, tough
Portulaca oleracea commonly known as "sunrose", loves sunshine for better blossom, may not flower without enough sunlight.
Portulaca grandiflora has triangular-lanceolate leaves, solitary colorful flowers on top of stems or branches, like a little sun, vivid and lovely. Typically used for garden ornament or home furnishings.
Portulaca oleracea likes plenty of sunlight, avoid direct sunlight in summer noon. Bloom in May-November for flower viewing in 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period May-November, viewing period 2-3 weeks
basic.color: Flower color red, orange, purple, yellow

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes adequate sunshine, properly shade in summer at noon under strong light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and summer
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely
